articles.title: Stock of the week: Alphabet is no longer just a search engine (05.02.2026)
articles.summary: Alphabet reported strong Q4 2025 results, with revenues exceeding $113 billion, driven by growth in Google Services, Search, and a significant 48% increase in Google Cloud revenue. The company plans to ramp up investment spending to $175–185 billion in 2026 to solidify its leadership in AI and cloud computing, despite potential short-term impacts on margins. A DCF analysis suggests an 18% upside potential, valuing Alphabet at $373.36 per share.

articles.title: AT&T hooks up with Amazon Leo to connect businesses
articles.summary: AT&T has entered into a multi-faceted agreement with Amazon, which includes utilizing Amazon Leo's upcoming satellite broadband network to provide connectivity to business customers beyond AT&T's existing network reach. Additionally, AT&T will integrate with AWS Outposts, Amazon Web Services' hybrid cloud offering, to migrate workloads and modernize its business support systems. The financial terms and specific launch timings for these services have not yet been disclosed, though Amazon Leo is still in the process of deploying its LEO satellite constellation.

articles.title: Sun Country Airlines stock hits 52-week high at $19.80 By Investing.com
articles.summary: Sun Country Airlines (SNCY) stock recently reached a new 52-week high of $19.80, reflecting a significant upward trend and strong financial health indicated by a Piotroski Score of 9. This growth comes amid news of their upcoming acquisition by Allegiant Travel Company and plans for a new operational base at Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport to support Amazon cargo operations.

articles.title: Oppenheimer Raises Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Target as AWS Momentum and Margin Expansion Accelerate
articles.summary: Oppenheimer has raised its price target for Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) to $315 from $305, maintaining an Outperform rating. This adjustment is based on anticipated accelerated growth in Amazon Web Services (AWS) and significant margin expansion in its e-commerce sector due to automation investments. The firm projects Amazon to be a leading mega-cap investment, despite news of Saks Global ending its e-commerce partnership with Amazon, which is not expected to materially impact Amazon's operations.

articles.title: Oppenheimer Raises Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Target as AWS Momentum and Margin Expansion Accelerate
articles.summary: Oppenheimer has raised its price target for Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) to $315 from $305, maintaining an Outperform rating. This increase is driven by strong Amazon Web Services (AWS) momentum, with Oppenheimer forecasting 24% AWS revenue growth for FY26, alongside significant margin expansion in Amazon's e-commerce segment due to automation investments. The firm estimates $7 billion in cumulative cost savings by FY27, reinforcing Amazon's position as a top mega-cap opportunity despite Saks Global ending its e-commerce partnership.

articles.title: Here's Why Broadridge Financial (BR) is Poised for a Turnaround After Losing 13.4% in 4 Weeks
articles.summary: Broadridge Financial Solutions (BR) has experienced a 13.4% decline in the past four weeks but is now showing signs of a potential turnaround. Technical indicators, specifically an oversold Relative Strength Index (RSI) of 25.73, suggest the selling pressure might be exhausting. Fundamentally, analysts have been raising earnings estimates for BR, and the company holds a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy), further indicating a possible rebound.

articles.title: Dow drops 215 points on losses for shares of Amazon.com Inc., Microsoft
articles.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped by 215 points due to declines in shares of major tech companies, Amazon.com Inc. and Microsoft. This indicates a challenging day for the stock market, particularly for the technology sector.

articles.title: Archer-Daniels-Midland Stock Outlook: Is Wall Street Bullish or Bearish?
articles.summary: Archer-Daniels-Midland (ADM) has significantly outperformed the broader S&P 500 and the VanEck Agribusiness ETF over the last year and year-to-date. Despite beating Q4 EPS expectations, ADM’s revenue fell short, leading to a "Hold" consensus rating from analysts, although the sentiment is slightly less bearish than a month prior. Morgan Stanley maintained a "Sell" rating with a price target of $50, while the stock currently trades above its mean target but offers limited upside to the Street-high target.

articles.title: Border patrol, Canadian ire dampening traffic at Simon malls
articles.summary: Simon Property Group CEO David Simon stated that while tariffs continue to negatively impact retailers, the company views store closures and bankruptcies as opportunities to replace distressed tenants with more productive ones at higher rents. He also noted that border control activity and Canadian dissatisfaction are dampening traffic at northern U.S. border malls, despite overall positive trends in sales and tenant demand post-pandemic.

articles.title: From Petah Tikva to orbit: Gilat Satellite Networks surges 160%, becoming an investor favorite
articles.summary: Gilat Satellite Networks, an Israeli company, has seen its share price jump over 160% in the past year due to strategic acquisitions, defense contracts, and major tender wins in the burgeoning satellite communications industry. While companies like Starlink and Amazon focus on deploying satellites, Gilat specializes in providing the crucial ground equipment that connects them, catering to telecom operators and militaries worldwide. CEO Adi Sfadia details the company's transformation from a struggling firm to an investor favorite, now valued at approximately 3.5 billion shekels, with significant growth potential in defense and new satellite platforms.

articles.title: Cummins (NYSE:CMI) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4 CY2025
articles.summary: Cummins (NYSE:CMI) reported better-than-expected revenue in Q4 CY2025, with sales increasing 1.1% year-on-year to $8.54 billion, surpassing analyst estimates. Despite robust sales and record full-year results in its Distribution and Power Systems segments, GAAP EPS missed expectations at $4.27 per share. The company's stock dipped slightly post-announcement, indicating mixed market reaction to the results.

articles.title: Apple Becomes Apple Again
articles.summary: Apple's stock has surged by 36% in the last six months, significantly outperforming the S&P 500, despite concerns about its lack of a proprietary AI product. This resurgence comes as other major AI companies like Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft face investor skepticism due to high investments and slow integration of AI into paid products. Apple's decision to integrate Google's Gemini AI into "Apple Intelligence" through a reported $1 billion annual deal is seen as a remarkably favorable move for the company.

articles.title: Music streamer LiveOne slashes costs 52% and eyes three Fortune 500 deals
articles.summary: LiveOne (NASDAQ: LVO) announced preliminary unaudited results for Q3 Fiscal 2026, estimating over $19.9 million in revenue and over $1.0 million in adjusted EBITDA, marking a 200% quarter-over-quarter increase. The company attributed this performance to a 52% year-over-year reduction in operating expenses, aiming for an additional $4-$5 million in headcount savings through AI, and the repayment of $2.5 million in debt. LiveOne also highlighted ongoing B2B partnerships and anticipates launching three Fortune 500 partnerships by year-end.

articles.title: LiveOne (Nasdaq: LVO) Expects $57.9M+ Fiscal 2026 YTD
articles.summary: LiveOne (Nasdaq: LVO) announced anticipated financial results for Q3 Fiscal 2026 and the nine months ended December 31, 2025, expecting over $57.9 million in YTD Fiscal 2026 revenue and over $19.9 million in Q3 Fiscal 2026 revenue. The company also anticipates over $1.0 million in Q3 Fiscal 2026 Adjusted EBITDA, a 200% quarter-over-quarter increase, driven by B2B partnerships and cost optimization through AI. LiveOne is targeting a 34% year-over-year headcount reduction, resulting in $4 million to $5 million in savings, and has paid off $2.5 million in debt.

articles.title: Amazon Earnings Are Imminent; These Most Accurate Analysts Revise Forecasts Ahead Of Earnings Call
articles.summary: Amazon.com (NASDAQ: AMZN) will release its fourth-quarter earnings results after market close on Thursday, February 5th. Analysts are forecasting earnings per share of $1.97 and revenue of $211.32 billion. Several top-rated analysts have recently reiterated Buy/Outperform ratings and adjusted price targets for Amazon ahead of the earnings call.

articles.title: Oracle's Larry Ellison is down an unmatched $49 billion this year after the plunge in software stocks
articles.summary: Oracle cofounder Larry Ellison has seen his net worth drop by an "unmatched" $49 billion this year, largely due to a 5% slump in Oracle stock. This decline follows a broader sell-off in software stocks, fueled by fears that new AI tools like Anthropic's Claude Cowork AI agent could reduce corporate demand for traditional software. Despite Oracle's significant investments in the AI boom, some analysts, like Michael Burry, have expressed concerns about the company's aggressive spending and growing debt pile.

articles.title: Amazon and Biogen Earnings: Still to Watch This Week
articles.summary: Amazon and Biogen are set to release their earnings reports this week, adding to the ongoing earnings season. Amazon's report will conclude the earnings releases from several Magnificent Seven tech companies, while Biogen's results will contribute to the pharmaceutical industry's reports. The jobs report expected on Friday has been postponed due to a partial government shutdown.

articles.title: Earnings Flash (CAH) Cardinal Health, Inc. Reports Q2 Revenue $65.63B, vs. FactSet Est of $65.08B
articles.summary: Cardinal Health, Inc. reported its second-quarter revenue of $65.63 billion, surpassing FactSet's estimate of $65.08 billion. This financial update was published on February 5, 2026, at 07:32 am EST. The company also posted an adjusted EPS of $2.63 per share, exceeding the FactSet estimate of $2.34.

articles.title: Amazon.com (AMZN) Set to Report Earnings as UBS Raises Price Target on AWS Outlook
articles.summary: UBS analyst Stephen Ju raised the price target for Amazon.com (AMZN) to $311.00, maintaining a Buy rating ahead of its 4Q25 earnings report. The firm increased estimates for AWS revenue and capital expenditures, projecting that AWS revenue could double by 2028, potentially generating an additional $20 billion in free cash flow. This outlook suggests improved investor confidence and continued outperformance for AMZN shares.

articles.title: Starbucks Corporation (NASDAQ:SBUX) Given Consensus Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" by Analysts
articles.summary: Starbucks Corporation (NASDAQ:SBUX) has received a "Moderate Buy" consensus recommendation from analysts, with an average 12-month price target of $104.67. Despite missing EPS estimates in its latest quarterly results, the company exceeded revenue expectations and provided FY2026 EPS guidance. While long-term growth is supported by menu simplification and U.S. store expansion plans, risks like union activity, a pessimistic Citigroup forecast, and recent insider sales present near-term headwinds.

articles.title: Amazon.com (AMZN) set to report earnings as UBS raises price target on AWS outlook
articles.summary: UBS has raised its price target for Amazon (AMZN) to $215, citing an improved outlook for Amazon Web Services (AWS) in 2024, particularly as clients optimize cloud spending. The firm anticipates AWS revenue growth to accelerate throughout the year due to new workloads and AI monetization, which is expected to support overall earnings. Amazon is scheduled to report its Q4 2023 earnings after market close, with analysts keen on the company's retail performance, advertising revenue, and AWS growth trajectory.

articles.title: Google Parent Alphabet Earnings Beat Fuels Analyst Price Target Hikes – But Capex Jitters Linger
articles.summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOG, GOOGL) surpassed Q4 analyst estimates with $113.8 billion in revenue and $2.82 EPS, driving multiple Wall Street firms to raise their price targets, citing strong AI and search momentum. However, shares fell over 2% premarket due to investor caution over the company's projected 2026 capital expenditure of $175 billion to $185 billion, significantly higher than previous estimates. Despite this, CEO Sundar Pichai remains optimistic about the revenue potential from these investments.

articles.title: Transcat (TRNS) Quarterly Loss Challenges Bullish Earnings Growth Narratives
articles.summary: Transcat (TRNS) reported a Q3 2026 loss of US$0.12 EPS and US$1.1 million net loss, despite revenue growth to US$83.9 million. While the company still shows a profit over the trailing twelve months, the quarterly loss and compressed net profit margin of 2.5% challenge bullish earnings growth forecasts of 26.2% annually. The stock's high P/E of 83.5x and a DCF fair value significantly below the current price suggest a rich valuation, prompting investors to scrutinize future profitability and growth execution.

articles.title: Tweedy Browne CO LLC Reduces Alphabet Inc. Stake
articles.summary: Tweedy Browne CO LLC recently reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. Class C (GOOG) by 6,272 shares. Despite this reduction, Alphabet Inc. Class C has seen a strong uptrend, with Wall Street maintaining a Strong Buy consensus due to the company's accelerating AI strategy and robust Google Cloud and Search outlook. Spark, TipRanks’ AI Analyst, rates GOOG as Outperform, citing strong financial performance and strategic investments in AI and cloud services as key drivers for its positive long-term outlook.

articles.title: Alecta Pensionsforsakring, Omsesidigt reduces Amazon.Com, Inc. stake
articles.summary: Alecta Pensionsforsakring, Omsesidigt, managed by Magnus Billing, has reduced its stake in Amazon.Com, Inc. (AMZN) by selling 96,600 shares. Despite this reduction and recent flat to modestly higher stock performance, Wall Street analysts maintain a strong bullish outlook on Amazon, citing anticipated acceleration in AWS growth driven by AI, resilient retail performance, and strong advertising growth. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates AMZN as "Outperform," highlighting strong financials but noting short-term technical weakness and a high P/E ratio.

articles.title: Franklin Resources Inc. Acquires Significant Stake in Adicet Bio Inc.
articles.summary: Franklin Resources Inc. has acquired 626,571 shares of Adicet Bio Inc. at $8.42 per share on December 31, 2025, marking a new holding for the prominent investment firm. This strategic move highlights Franklin Resources Inc.'s interest in the biotechnology sector and Adicet Bio Inc.'s potential for growth despite current financial challenges. The acquisition aligns with Franklin Resources Inc.'s diversified investment philosophy, focusing on sectors with robust growth potential.

articles.title: Franklin Resources Inc. Expands Holdings in Contineum Therapeuti
articles.summary: Franklin Resources Inc. has increased its holdings in Contineum Therapeutics Inc. by adding 223,819 shares, bringing its total to 1,879,367 shares. This move signals confidence in the biopharmaceutical company's long-term potential, despite its current financial challenges and a low GF Score. Contineum Therapeutics, a clinical-stage firm, focuses on innovative therapies, and its stock has shown recent gains, though profitability and growth metrics remain negative.

articles.title: A Look At Sonoco Products (SON) Valuation After New Long Term Renewable Power Agreement
articles.summary: Sonoco Products (SON) has begun receiving power from a long-term Virtual Power Purchase Agreement, leading to positive investor reaction and a recent stock price increase. Despite trading at a P/E ratio higher than its industry peers, the company is still considered undervalued by analysts, with a fair value of $53.75 compared to its current price of $51.62. Future growth is anticipated through robust expansion in metal packaging and new contract wins, though potential risks like integration issues and softer demand could impact margins.

articles.title: Is Instacart’s Expanded Costco Partnership in Europe Altering The Investment Case For Maplebear (CART)?
articles.summary: Instacart (Maplebear, CART) has expanded its partnership with Costco into France and Spain for same-day delivery and deepened its technology collaboration with Allegiance Retail Services in the US. These moves aim to monetize enterprise software, scale retail media, and test international opportunities. While potentially influencing investor sentiment positively through growth in order volume and high-margin services, the partnerships also highlight risks such as customer concentration and execution in new markets.

articles.title: Radware Unveils Agentic AI Protection Solution to Shield Enterprises from New Agentic Threats
articles.summary: Radware has launched its Agentic AI Protection Solution, expanding its platform into the AI security market. This solution is designed to protect autonomous AI agents from new threats like direct and indirect prompt injection attacks, tool abuse, and unauthorized data access. It leverages proprietary behavioral analysis to identify malicious intent in real-time, distinguishing it from traditional software-based guardrails, and comes after Radware's discovery of the "ZombieAgent" vulnerability.

Future growth is anticipated through robust expansion in metal packaging and new contract wins, though potential risks like integration issues and softer demand could impact margins.

last_30_days.title: Is Instacart’s Expanded Costco Partnership in Europe Altering The Investment Case For Maplebear (CART)?
last_30_days.summary: Instacart (Maplebear, CART) has expanded its partnership with Costco into France and Spain for same-day delivery and deepened its technology collaboration with Allegiance Retail Services in the US. These moves aim to monetize enterprise software, scale retail media, and test international opportunities. While potentially influencing investor sentiment positively through growth in order volume and high-margin services, the partnerships also highlight risks such as customer concentration and execution in new markets.

last_30_days.title: Radware Unveils Agentic AI Protection Solution to Shield Enterprises from New Agentic Threats
last_30_days.summary: Radware has launched its Agentic AI Protection Solution, expanding its platform into the AI security market. This solution is designed to protect autonomous AI agents from new threats like direct and indirect prompt injection attacks, tool abuse, and unauthorized data access. It leverages proprietary behavioral analysis to identify malicious intent in real-time, distinguishing it from traditional software-based guardrails, and comes after Radware's discovery of the "ZombieAgent" vulnerability.
